MainClaim.text: "Pico's philosophy is influenced by Anaxagoras' principle that everything is in everything in their own mode."

s interpretation of Anaxagoras.text: "Pico interprets Anaxagoras' philosophy to support his own views on the nature of the Intellect."

s influence on his metaphysics.text: "Anaxagoras' principle that everything is in everything in their own mode influences Pico's metaphysics."

s method of allegorical interpretation.text: "Anaxagoras' principle is supportive to Pico's method of allegorical interpretation."

s anthropocentrism.text: "Pico rejects the fixed position of man in the ontological hierarchy

s relation to Anaxagoras.text: "Pico refutes Anaxagoras' argument that the Intellect is separate and unmixed

Intellect.text: "Pico's interpretation of Anaxagoras' Intellect is influenced by Plotinus' interpretation."

s argumentation is ambivalent.text: "Pico's argumentation is ambivalent and lacks consistency."

creation myth.text: "Pico's view on creation is not compatible with Anaxagoras' model."

principle.text: "Pico uses Anaxagoras' principle to support his own views on the nature of the Intellect."
